moves.3. f4 Qf6: Might have looked at Nc6,Nd7 or exf. The queen is out a little early and could become a target. But it's not a terrible move
moves.4. Nf3 exf4 5. exf4 Bc5: Looks like a good move but as you soon see white builds his pawn center while your bishop dances. Maybe Bd6 was better
moves.6. d4 Bb4+ 7. c3 Ba5 8. Qa4+ c6: A blunder. Many times when the queen does this double attack with check, the knight can go to c6 and protect the attacked piece at either a5 or b4, this is one of those times. Or if the knight Itself is attacked it can go to c6 and block the check.
moves.9. Qxa5 Qe6+ 10. Ne5: A blunder. f6 and the knight will be lost for a pawn.
moves.10... b6 11. Qa3 Nd7: f6 needs to be played here.White plays Kf2 or Kd1 and the pin is broken.
moves.12. Bd3: White gives you one more chance
moves.14... fxe5: Also to be considered is QxQ giving him isolated doubled rook pawns.It's not bad to trade since material is even again.
moves.19. Kf2: Nc5 attacks the bishop and frees yours to attack f5.
moves.20... Qxe1: Taking advantage of it again, sometimes you just play solid and notice your opponent's mistakes and all of a sudden you've won
moves.21. Bg5 c5: Good move as QxNe7 is mate. Also is Qxe5
moves.22. f6 h6: Lots of stuff going on over there now, got to be careful.Not a bad move though. You also have Qxe5, if then fxNe7 you have QxB, if fxg you still play QxB with check then pick up the pawn next move.
moves.23. Bg6+ Nxg6 24. Qb3: Not sure what he's thinking. fxg Rg8 Bxh6 I would done
moves.25. Qxd5 Qe2+ 26. Kg3 Qxe5+: Very nice move. Win a pawn And force white to trade queens and lesser his attacking chances, now u can just mop up and win.
